definitions.text: where you live at a particular time
examples: deliver the package to my home
he doesn't have a home to go to

definitions.text: housing that someone is living in
examples: he built a modest dwelling near the pond
they raise money to provide homes for the homeless

definitions.text: the country or state or city where you live
examples: Canadian tariffs enabled United States lumber companies to raise prices at home

definitions.text: (baseball) base consisting of a rubber slab where the batter stands; it must be touched by a base runner in order to score
examples: he ruled that the runner failed to touch home

definitions.text: the place where you are stationed and from which missions start and end
place where something began and flourished
examples: the United States is the home of basketball

definitions.text: an environment offering affection and security
examples: home is where the heart is
he grew up in a good Christian home
he moved his family to Virginia
It was a good Christian household
I waited until the whole house was asleep
the teacher asked how many people made up his home

definitions.text: an institution where people are cared for
provide with, or send to, a home
return home accurately from a long distance
relating to or being where one lives or where one's roots are

examples: the British Home Office has broader responsibilities than the United States Department of the Interior

definitions.text: at or to or in the direction of one's home or family
examples: after the game the children brought friends home for supper
I hope you will come home for Christmas

definitions.text: on or to the point aimed at
to the fullest extent; to the heart
